column12: SOLID ELECTROLYTE MATERIAL, LITHIUM BATTERY, AND MANUFACTURING METHOD FOR SOLID ELECTROLYTE MATERIAL
column13: Disclosed is an Li-La-Ti-O solid electrolyte material in which the Li ion conductivity of the crystal grain boundaries is high. The solid electrolyte material is characterised in being represented by the general formula Li 3x (La (2/3-x)-a M1 a )(Ti 1-b M2 b )O 3 , being crystalline, being a thin film, and having a thickness in the range of 250nm-850nm. (In the formula: x satisfies 0<x<0.17; a satisfies 0≤a≤0.5; b satisfies 0≤b≤0.5; M1 is at least one selected from a group comprising Sr, Na, Nd, Pr, Sm, Gd, Dy, Y, Eu, Tb, and Ba; and M2 is at least one selected from a group comprising Mg, W, Mn, Al, Ge, Ru, Nb, Ta, Co, Zr, Hf, Fe, Cr, and Ga.)
column14: TOYOTA MOTOR CO LTD;;YADA CHIHIRO;;YOKOISHI SHOJI;;HAYDEN BRIAN ELLIOTT;;LE GALL THIERRY;;SMITH DUNCAN CLIFFORD ALAN;;LEE CHRISTOPHER EDWARD

column12: SOLID ELECTROLYTE MATERIAL, LITHIUM BATTERY, AND METHOD OF PRODUCING SOLID ELECTROLYTE MATERIAL
column13: A main object of the present invention is to provide a Li-La-Ti-O based solid electrolyte material having high Li ion conductivity in the crystal grain boundary. The present invention attains the object by providing solid electrolyte material represented by a general formula: Li 3x (La (2/3−x)−a M1 a ) (Ti 1−b M2 b )O 3 , wherein “x” is 0<x<0.17; “a” is 0≦a≦0.5; “b” is 0≦b≦0.5; “M1” is at least one selected from the group consisting of Sr, Na, Nd, Pr, Sm, Gd, Dy, Y, Eu, Tb, and Ba; and “M2” is at least one selected from the group consisting of Mg, W, Mn, Al, Ge, Ru, Nb, Ta, Co, Zr, Hf, Fe, Cr, and Ga, and wherein the solid electrolyte material is a crystalline material, is in thin film form, and has a thickness of 250 nm to 850 nm.

column12: Solid electrolyte material, lithium battery, and manufacturing method for solid electrolyte material
column13: Disclosed is an Li-La-Ti-O solid electrolyte material in which the Li ion conductivity of the crystal grain boundaries is high. The solid electrolyte material is characterised in being represented by the general formula Li3x(La(2/3-x)-aM1a)(Ti1-bM2b)O3, being crystalline, being a thin film, and having a thickness in the range of 250nm-850nm. (In the formula: x satisfies 0<x<0.17; a satisfies 0=a=0.5; b satisfies 0=b=0.5; M1 is at least one selected from a group comprising Sr, Na, Nd, Pr, Sm, Gd, Dy, Y, Eu, Tb, and Ba; and M2 is at least one selected from a group comprising Mg, W, Mn, Al, Ge, Ru, Nb, Ta, Co, Zr, Hf, Fe, Cr, and Ga.)

column12: Systems and Method for Automatic Prostate Localization in MR Images Using Random Walker Segmentation Initialized Via Boosted Classifiers
column13: Automatic prostate localization in T2-weighted MR images facilitate labor-intensive cancer imaging techniques. Methods and systems to accurately segment the prostate gland in MR images are provided and address large variations in prostate anatomy and disease, intensity inhomogeneities, and artifacts induced by endorectal coils. A center of the prostate is automatically detected with a boosted classifier trained on intensity based multi-level Gaussian Mixture Model Expectation Maximization (GMM-EM) segmentations of the raw MR images. A shape model is used in conjunction with Multi-Label Random Walker (MLRW) to constrain the seeding process within MLRW.

column12: Solid electrolyte material, lithium battery, and method of producing solid electrolyte material
column13: A main object of the present invention is to provide a solid electrolyte material having excellent Li ion conductivity. To attain the object, the present invention provides a solid electrolyte material represented by a general formula: Li x (La 1-a M1 a ) y (Ti 1-b M2 b ) z O δ , wherein “x”, “y”, and “z” satisfy relations of x+y+z=1, 0.850≦x/(x+y+z)≦0.930, and 0.087≦y/(y+z)≦0.115; “a” is 0≦a≦1; “b” is 0≦b≦1; “δ” is 0.8≦δ≦1.2; “M1” is at least one selected from the group consisting of Sr, Na, Nd, Pr, Sm, Gd, Dy, Y, Eu, Tb, and Ba; and “M2” is at least one selected from the group consisting of Mg, W, Mn, Al, Ge, Ru, Nb, Ta, Co, Zr, Hf, Fe, Cr, and Ga.

column12: Solid electrolyte material, lithium battery, and manufacturing method for solid electrolyte material
column13: Disclosed is a solid electrolyte material having good Li ion conductivity. The solid electrolyte material is characterised in being represented by the general formula Lix(La2-aM1a)(Ti3-bM2b)O9+sigma. (In the formula: x satisfies 0<x<=1; a satisfies 0<=a<=2; b satisfies 0<=b<=3; sigma satisfies -2<sigma<=2; M1 is at least one selected from a group comprising Sr, Na, Nd, Pr, Sm, Gd, Dy, Y, Eu, Tb, and Ba; and M2 is at least one selected from a group comprising Mg, W, Mn, Al, Ge, Ru, Nb, Ta, Co, Zr, Hf, Fe, Cr, and Ga.)

column12: Systems and method for automatic prostate localization in MR images using random walker segmentation initialized via boosted classifiers
column13: Automatic prostate localization in T2-weighted MR images facilitate labor-intensive cancer imaging techniques. Methods and systems to accurately segment the prostate gland in MR images are provided and address large variations in prostate anatomy and disease, intensity inhomogeneities, and artifacts induced by endorectal coils. A center of the prostate is automatically detected with a boosted classifier trained on intensity based multi-level Gaussian Mixture Model Expectation Maximization (GMM-EM) segmentations of the raw MR images. A shape model is used in conjunction with Multi-Label Random Walker (MLRW) to constrain the seeding process within MLRW.

(In the formula: x, y, and z satisfy x+y+z=1, 0.850=x/(x+y+z)=0.930, 0.087=y/(y+z)=0.115; a satisfies 0=a=1; b satisfies 0=b=1; d satisfies 0.8=d=1.2; M1 is at least one selected from a group comprising Sr, Na, Nd, Pr, Sm, Gd, Dy, Y, Eu, Tb, and Ba; and M2 is at least one selected from a group comprising Mg, W, Mn, Al, Ge, Ru, Nb, Ta, Co, Zr, Hf, Fe, Cr, and Ga.).

column12: SOLID ELECTROLYTE MATERIAL, LITHIUM BATTERY, AND MANUFACTURING METHOD FOR SOLID ELECTROLYTE MATERIAL
column13: Disclosed is a solid electrolyte material having good Li ion conductivity. The solid electrolyte material is characterised in being represented by the general formula Li x (La 1-a M1 a ) y (Ti 1-b M2 b ) z O δ . (In the formula: x, y, and z satisfy x+y+z=1, 0.850≤x/(x+y+z)≤0.930, 0.087≤y/(y+z)≤0.115; a satisfies 0≤a≤1; b satisfies 0≤b≤1; δ satisfies 0.8≤δ≤1.2; M1 is at least one selected from a group comprising Sr, Na, Nd, Pr, Sm, Gd, Dy, Y, Eu, Tb, and Ba; and M2 is at least one selected from a group comprising Mg, W, Mn, Al, Ge, Ru, Nb, Ta, Co, Zr, Hf, Fe, Cr, and Ga.)
